dkeep.logic

Class Hero

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Hero

  • public class Hero
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that keeps all the hero's info including its position, the map type and if there is a basher or not, the map array, the key position and if he has caught it already
    Author:
    Leonardo Capozzi, Ricardo Carvalho

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Hero(int[] heropos, int b)
      Creates an object of type hero

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getBasher()
      Gets hero's basher status (if he has it or not)
      int[] getHero()
      Gets hero's position in the map
      void HeroMove(Map m, java.lang.String move)
      Sets in motion verifications for the hero's next move, he can only move into an empty space, a lever/key and an open door

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Hero

        public Hero(int[] heropos,
            int b)
        Creates an object of type hero
        Parameters:
        heropos - hero's starting coordinates
        b - 0 if hero has no basher and 1 otherwise

    • Method Detail

      • getHero

        public int[] getHero()
        Gets hero's position in the map
        Returns:
        hero's current coordinates

      • getBasher

        public int getBasher()
        Gets hero's basher status (if he has it or not)
        Returns:
        0 if there is no basher and 1 otherwise

      • HeroMove

        public void HeroMove(Map m,
                     java.lang.String move)
        Sets in motion verifications for the hero's next move, he can only move into an empty space, a lever/key and an open door
        Parameters:
        m - map that includes the hero
        move - string with the direction os the hero's movement("w" for up, "a" for left, "s" for down and "d" for right)
